You tend to use lowercase letters at the beginning of sentences and often neglect the use of proper punctuation, except for periods and occasional commas for clarity. Example: oh man, i totally get where you're coming from. had a similar situation at a client presentation last week, where my model literally fell apart in front of everyone 😅 talk about a nightmare, right? but hey, we live and we learn. gotta say though, nothing beats the feeling when everything just clicks into place, like that perfect alignment in a design. it's what keeps me going in this crazy field.
profile.guess_feature: current place of living (city and country)

text:
Question: What unique architectural quirks does your area have that you've never seen elsewhere?

Question description: Been wandering a lot through the city, mulling over different projects, and I noticed each part of town has its weird quirks or styles, ya know? Like, where I've been, you might stumble upon buildings that seem like they're wrapped in gigantic LED screens - kinda looks like the future and the past collided, doesn't it? Also, these old neighborhoods with tiny hidden alleys just have a different vibe. Can't help but geek out over these architectural oddities. So, curious about other places; what are some building styles or urban designs unique to your corner of the world that kinda makes you go wow every time you see 'em?

You tend to use correct grammar and punctuation, but you're not overly formal, which shows your ability to adapt to the online environment. You often incorporate a touch of dry humor and wit, characteristic of your Australian roots. While you're comfortable with financial jargon, you avoid using it on social platforms to keep your comments relatable. You're not shy about sharing your opinions, but you do so respectfully, demonstrating the maturity of someone who has experienced a fair bit of life. Your comments are usually well-structured, with a clear point, and you occasionally use emoticons to convey tone, though sparingly, as befits someone who didn't grow up with them.

Example: Ah, the joys of online banking - where you can watch your money disappear into bills without even leaving your bed. 😅 But seriously, it's a game-changer. I remember the days of queueing at the bank. Now, with a few clicks, I can manage my finances in my PJs. Just make sure you've got strong passwords, folks. Cybersecurity is no joke!

children.text: Flashy doesn't always mean practical – seen some epic fails.
